description:
### Document name - AWSFIS-Run-Network-Latency-Sources

## What does this document do?
It adds latency with jitter using tc, to outgoing or incoming traffic from a configurable list of sources (Supported: IPv4, IPv4/CIDR, Domain name, DYNAMODB|S3). If tc is not already installed on the instance, this SSM document will install it together with other dependencies listed below.
This SSM document supports Amazon Linux and Ubuntu operating systems only.

## Dependencies installed by this SSM Document
* atd
* curl
* dig
* jq
* kmod
* lsof
* pgrep
* tc
Note: This SSM document does not uninstall dependencies once installed. If you don't want this SSM document to install any dependencies, set InstallDependencies to False and bake the dependencies into your EC2 instance. For example, by using image-builder (https://aws.amazon.com/image-builder/).
Note: Before you run this document, enable the kernel module sch_netem. To check if installed, run the following command on your instance - lsmod | grep sch_netem. On success, you will see sch_netem as output. If there is no output, run depmod -a to build a list of modules, and then run modprobe sch_netem. If you get an error, then the module is not available. If you are using Amazon Linux and the module is not available, verify that you are using the latest AMI and that you have installed the latest updates.

## Input Parameters
* Interface: The interface to add delay to (default: eth0).
* Sources: (Required) Specify a comma separated list of sources to add delay to (Supported: IPv4, IPv4/CIDR, Domain name, DYNAMODB|S3).
* TrafficType: Specify the type of traffic to delay (egress|ingress) (default: ingress).
* DelayMilliseconds: The delay - in milliseconds - to add to the interface (default: 200).
* JitterMilliseconds: The jitter -  in milliseconds - to add to the delay (default: 10).
* DurationSeconds: (Required) The duration - in seconds - of the fault injection.
* InstallDependencies: If set to True, Systems Manager installs the required dependencies on the target instances (default: True).

## Output Parameters
None.

Interface.description: The interface to add delay to (default: eth0).

Sources.description: (Required) Specify a comma separated list of sources to add delay to (Supported: IPv4, IPv4/CIDR, Domain name, DYNAMODB|S3).

TrafficType.description: Specify the type of traffic to delay (egress|ingress) (default: ingress).

DelayMilliseconds.description: The delay - in milliseconds - to add to the interface (default: 200).

JitterMilliseconds.description: The jitter -  in milliseconds - to add to the delay (default: 10).

DurationSeconds.description: (Required) The duration - in seconds - of the fault injection.

InstallDependencies.description: If set to True, Systems Manager installs the required dependencies on the target instances (default: True).

mainSteps.name: InstallDependencies
mainSteps.description:
## Parameter: InstallDependencies
If set to True, this step installs the required dependency via operating system's repository. It supports both
Debian (apt) and CentOS (yum) based package managers.

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash

validate_installation_settings() {
  if [[ "{{ InstallDependencies }}" == False ]]; then
    echo "Dependencies are not installed - Please set InstallDependencies to True."
    exit 1
  fi
  echo "Installing required dependencies"
}

#################################
#       Dependency Logic        #
#################################

function install_sch_netem_module() {
  ssm_working_dir=$(pwd)
  # Work from a directory that Amazon SSM Agent creates
  cd /etc/amazon/ssm/
  current_working_dir=$(pwd)
  kernel_version=$(uname -r)
  # Default location of sch_netem module
  sched_module_local_path=/lib/modules/"$kernel_version"/kernel/net/sched/
  sch_netem_kernel_module_file=sch_netem.ko
  # Check if there is no compressed and uncompressed version of the module
  if [ ! -f "${sched_module_local_path}$sch_netem_kernel_module_file" ] && [ ! -f "${sched_module_local_path}$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz ]; then
    echo "sch_netem does not exist, installing"
    # We will download and install the sch_netem kernel module to avoid the need for a reboot, as
    # would be required if we used `yum install kernel-modules-extra`.
    temp_dir=kernel-lib
    # If the yumdownloader comes back with no module available, then fail
    if yumdownloader kernel-modules-extra-"$kernel_version" --destdir "$temp_dir" 2>&1 | grep "No package kernel-modules-extra-$kernel_version available."; then
      echo "No sch_netem module for the kernel version $kernel_version"
      echo "Exiting - Unable to install sch_netem. kernel module sch_netem must be installed for this document to run"
      rm -rf "$temp_dir"
      exit 1
    fi
    # We need to CD into the temp_dir for cpio since it does not work with absolute or relative paths well
    cd "$temp_dir"
    # Unpacks the modules into lib/
    # version is downloaded but will differ from $kernel_version, depending OS.
    rpm2cpio kernel-modules-extra-"$kernel_version".rpm | cpio -id
    # Move back to the working dir.
    cd "$current_working_dir"
    # if sch_netem exists in the rpm lib, move it to /etc/amazon/ssm
    sch_netem_path=$(find "$temp_dir"/lib -name "$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz)
    if [ -n "${sch_netem_path}" ]; then
      echo "Downloaded Kernel Modules, and sch_netem exists. Loading Module"
      mv "${sch_netem_path}" "$current_working_dir"
      # Do not need the rest of the temp_dir
      rm -rf "$temp_dir"
      echo "Unpacking sch_netem"
      xz -d "$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz
      rm -f "$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz
      # Create a symlink to the default location so that the module can be added to the list of available modules by depmod
      ln -s "$current_working_dir"/$sch_netem_kernel_module_file /lib/modules/"$kernel_version"/"$sch_netem_kernel_module_file"
      echo "Loading sch_netem"
      # Refresh the list of available modules
      depmod -a
      modprobe sch_netem
      # Check if loaded successfully
      if lsmod | grep -wq "sch_netem"; then
        echo "$sch_netem_kernel_module_file module installed and loaded"
      else
        echo "Exiting - Error loading module, kernel module sch_netem.ko must be installed for this document to run"
        exit 1
      fi
    else
      # make sure our temp file deleted.
      rm -rf "$temp_dir"
      echo "Exiting - Unable to install sch_netem. kernel module sch_netem must be installed for this document to run"
      exit 1
    fi
  # Check if the module exists and enable it
  elif [[ -f "${sched_module_local_path}/$sch_netem_kernel_module_file" ]]; then
    if modinfo ${sched_module_local_path}/$sch_netem_kernel_module_file -F vermagic | awk '{print $1}' | grep -Fi "$kernel_version"; then
      # Lets build an updated list of available modules first
      depmod -a
      # Insert module
      modprobe sch_netem
    fi
  # if the compressed module exist, uncompress and enable
  elif [[ -f "${sched_module_local_path}$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz ]] && [ ! -f "${sched_module_local_path}$sch_netem_kernel_module_file" ]; then
    # Module exists, so we need to unpack it and insert the module in the kernel it
    xz -d -k "${sched_module_local_path}/$sch_netem_kernel_module_file".xz
    if modinfo ${sched_module_local_path}/$sch_netem_kernel_module_file -F vermagic | awk '{print $1}' | grep -Fi "$kernel_version"; then
      # Lets build an updated list of available modules first
      depmod -a
      # Insert module
      modprobe sch_netem
    fi
  fi
  cd "$ssm_working_dir"
}

function check_and_install_netem() {
  if ! lsmod | grep -wq "sch_netem"; then
    # To avoid issues with SELinux we wrap everything in sudo.
    # In order to call the install_sch_netem_module function wrapped with sudo,
    # we need to pass it as a command rather than a function call.
    SUDOINSTALL=$(declare -f install_sch_netem_module)
    sudo bash -c "$SUDOINSTALL; install_sch_netem_module" 2>&1
    # Check if loaded
    if lsmod | grep -wq "sch_netem"; then
      echo "sch_netem.ko Module loaded"
    else
      echo "Exiting - Error loading module, kernel module sch_netem.ko must be installed for this document to run"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi
}

function adjust_rhel_package() {
  # For centos/rhel 7 the package is iproute, so remove the suffix if iproute is there
  # since this command is directly related to the use of sch_netem.
  if [[ ${rhel_package} == *iproute-tc* ]] && [ "$os_major_version_number" -eq "7" ]; then
    rhel_package=${rhel_package/iproute-tc/iproute}
  fi
}

# Configure ATD service if required
configure_atd() {
  if ! systemctl is-enabled atd || ! systemctl is-active atd; then
    echo "Enabling and starting atd"
    systemctl enable atd
    systemctl start atd
  fi
}

########################################################################################################################
 # This script builds a list of available modules and enables sch_netem                                                #
 # sch_netem kernel module is responsible for emulating traffic,                                                       #
 # FIS SSM Documents use this module when creating network faults, such as the packet loss fault and the latency fault #
########################################################################################################################
# Build a list of the available modules
enable_netem() {
  if ! command -v depmod &> /dev/null; then
    echo "WARN depmod is not available. Command could fail due to missing sch_netem"
    return 0
  else
    depmod -a
    # Enable the sch_netem module, if there is a failure, exit
    if ! modprobe sch_netem; then
      echo "WARN Cannot enable sch_netem"
      echo "WARN Command could fail due to missing sch_netem"
      return 0
    fi
  fi
  return 0
}

# Check if dependencies are already installed
check_existing_dependencies() {
  if [[ "$( command -v atd 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v curl 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v dig 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v jq 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v kmod 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v lsof 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v pgrep 2>/dev/null )" && "$( command -v tc 2>/dev/null )" ]]; then
  
    depmod -a
    if modprobe sch_netem; then
      exit
    fi
  
  fi
}

# Handle Amazon Linux installations
install_amazon_linux() {
  if ! grep -Fiq 'VERSION_ID="2023"' /etc/os-release; then
  
    # Use amazon-linux-extras if available (Amazon Linux 2)
    command -v amazon-linux-extras 2>/dev/null 1>&2 && amazon-linux-extras install testing
  
    yum -y install at bind-utils jq kmod lsof procps-ng tc
  elif grep -Fiq 'ID="amzn"' /etc/os-release && grep -Fiq 'VERSION_ID="2023"' /etc/os-release; then
      enable_netem
  
    yum -y install at curl-minimal bind-utils jq kmod lsof procps-ng iproute-tc
  else
    echo "Exiting - This SSM document supports: Amazon Linux 2023, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu, CentOS 9 and RHEL (8, 9) operating systems"
    exit 1
  fi
}

# Handle RHEL/CentOS installations
install_rhel_centos() {
  # Fetch OS Version
  os_version_number=$(grep -oP '(?<=^VERSION_ID=).+' /etc/os-release | tr -d '"')
  # if the version has a decimal, this line will remove it
  os_major_version_number=${os_version_number%.*}
  # Replace with version number in the url if required
  if ! rpm --quiet -q epel-release; then
    epel_dl_url="https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-VERSION.noarch.rpm"
    epel_with_version="${epel_dl_url/VERSION/$os_major_version_number}"
    yum -y install $epel_with_version
  fi
  rhel_package="at bind-utils jq kmod lsof procps iproute-tc"
    check_and_install_netem
  adjust_rhel_package
  yum -y install $rhel_package
}

# Handle Ubuntu installations
install_ubuntu() {
  apt-get update -y
  # when installing, sometimes ubuntu has stderr that are not breaking errors.
  install_error=$(apt-get install -y at dnsutils jq kmod lsof procps iproute2 2>&1)
  if [[ -n "$install_error" ]]; then
    echo "$install_error"
  fi

  ubuntu_commands=( atd curl dig jq kmod lsof pgrep tc )
  for dependency_command in "${ubuntu_commands[@]}"; do
    if ! command -v $dependency_command >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      echo "Exiting - $dependency_command not installed"
      exit 1
    fi
  done
}

# Main function to orchestrate the installation process
main() {
  check_existing_dependencies
  validate_installation_settings

  if [ -f "/etc/system-release" ] && grep -i 'Amazon Linux' /etc/system-release; then
    install_amazon_linux
  elif grep -Fiq 'ID="centos"' /etc/os-release || grep -Fiq 'ID="rhel"' /etc/os-release; then
    install_rhel_centos
  elif grep -i "Ubuntu" /etc/issue; then
    install_ubuntu
  else
    echo "Exiting - This SSM document supports: Amazon Linux 2023, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu, CentOS 9 and RHEL (8, 9) operating systems"
    exit 1
  fi
  configure_atd
}

# Execute main function
main

mainSteps.name: FaultInjection
mainSteps.description:
## Parameters: Sources, TrafficType, Interface, DelayMilliseconds, JitterMilliseconds and DurationSeconds
This step starts by extracting the IP for all the `Sources` provided and adds a `DelayMilliseconds` with `JitterMilliseconds` delay to `TrafficType` traffic on the `Interface` for the given `DurationSeconds`, using the `tc` (Traffic Control) command.
The script will inject latency on the `TrafficType` traffic for the `Sources`, and wait for the given duration to remove that. It has two rollback mechanisms in place:
* It will listen for exit signals (SIGINT and SIGTERM), and will stop the latency injection if any of them is received.
* It will periodically enqueue rollback checks into a queue (using `at` command). This way, if the command is stopped and the rollback
was not executed, the enqueued commands will try to stop it. (for example, if the command is stopped using kill -9). This is just
an extra safety check to avoid having the latency remain injected after the script is no longer running.

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash
set -o errexit -o errtrace -o nounset -o pipefail

########################
# Fault-specific logic #
########################

INTERFACE={{ Interface }}
DELAYMILLISECONDS={{ DelayMilliseconds }}
JITTERMILLISECONDS={{ JitterMilliseconds }}
DURATION={{ DurationSeconds }}
SOURCES={{ Sources }}
TRAFFIC_TYPE={{ TrafficType }}

validate_parameter_within_range() {
  local parameter=$1
  local value=$2
  local min=$3
  local max=$4

  if (( value >= min && value <= max )); then
    return 0
  fi

  echo "Parameter $parameter must be between $min and $max, was: '$value'" >&2
  exit 1
}

validate_running_in_ssm_document() {
  # Check if the script is running in an SSM document by verifying that AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME environment variable is set
  if [[ -n "${AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME-}" ]]; then
    return 0
  fi

  echo "Environment variable AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME is not set. Run this script as part of an SSM document." >&2
  exit 1
}

validate_parameter_is_positive() {
  local -r parameter="$1"
  local -r value="$2"

  if (( value >= 1 )); then
    return 0
  fi

  echo "Parameter $parameter must be a positive value, was: '$value'" >&2
  exit 1
}

validate_interface_exists() {
  local -r interface="$1"

  if [[ "$( ip a ls "$interface" 2>/dev/null )" ]]; then
    return 0
  fi

  echo "Interface $interface does not exist." >&2
  exit 1
}

validate_network_ingress_fault_not_running() {
  local -r traffic_type="$1"

  if [ "$traffic_type" = "ingress" ]; then
    ip a ls ifb0 1>/dev/null 2>&1 && { echo "Fault might be already running (Interface ifb0 already exists). Exiting..." 1>&2 ; exit 1; }
  fi

  return 0
}

validate_protected_ips_not_in_target_ips() {
  local -r ips="$1"
  local -r ssm_ips="$2"

  # Converts space-separated strings to arrays
  local -a ip_array
  local -a ssm_ip_array
  read -ra ip_array <<< "$ips"
  read -ra ssm_ip_array <<< "$ssm_ips"

  # Checks if any of the SSM endpoint IPs are in the sources and exiting if true
  for e in "${ip_array[@]}"; do
    for ip in "${ssm_ip_array[@]}"; do
      [[ "$e" = "$ip" ]] &&
        { 
          echo "Sources contain protected SSM endpoint: ${e} - exiting" >&2
          temp_file=$(mktemp)
          sed "/${DELETE_MSG:-"#delete-after-fault-injection"}/d" "${HOSTS_FILE:-/etc/hosts}" > $temp_file
          cat $temp_file > "${HOSTS_FILE:-/etc/hosts}"
          rm -f $temp_file
          exit 1
        }
    done
  done

  return 0
}

force_dns() {
  local -r hostname="$1"    # Hostname is expected as first argument
  local -ar ips=("${@:2}")  # The rest will be the IPs

  # Force any new DNS resolution for that host to the latest known IPs
  for ip in "${ips[@]}"; do
    echo "$ip $hostname ${DELETE_MSG:-"#delete-after-fault-injection"}" >> "${HOSTS_FILE:-/etc/hosts}"
  done

  return 0
}

add_imds_ip_to_protected_endpoints() {
  local -r instance_id="$1"

  # Only on EC2 instances add EC2 metadata. On-premise instances will be prefixed with "mi-"
  if [[ "$instance_id" =~ ^i-.* ]]; then
    echo "Running on EC2 instance. Adding EC2 metadata IP to PROTECTED_ENDPOINTS"
    PROTECTED_ENDPOINTS+=("${IMDS_IP:-"169.254.169.254"}") 
  fi

  return 0
}

get_target_ips_from_sources() {
  local get_ips="$1"
  local sources="$2"

  # Prepares the sources and get IPs for all of them
  local -a invalid_sources=()
  for source in ${sources//,/ }; do
    ips=$(eval "get_ips \"$source\"")
    if [ -n "$ips" ]; then
      for ip in ${ips[*]}; do
        TARGET_IPS+=("${ip}")
      done
    else
      invalid_sources+=("${source}")
    fi
  done

  if [ ${#invalid_sources[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "Invalid sources (malformed service name, DNS or IP address): ${invalid_sources[*]}" >&2
    exit 1
  fi

  echo "Target IPs and ranges: ${TARGET_IPS[*]}"

  return 0
}

get_ips_from_input() {
  local -r input="$1"
  local -r regex="$2"

  # Echoes the input and returns 0 if the input is valid, otherwise returns 1
  local -r validated_input=$(grep -E "$regex" <<< "$input")
  [ -z "$validated_input" ] || { echo "$validated_input" ; return 0 ;}

  return 1
}

get_ips_from_dns() {
  local -r domain="$1"
  local -a resolved_ips=()

  # Echoes IPs of the domain and forces DNS resolution to the IPs then returns 0, otherwise returns 1
  # Since `dig` can return different IPs, we call it 10 times to maximize the chances of covering as many IPs as possible for the provided domain
  for _ in {1..10}
    do
      local -a dig_output=( $(dig +short "$domain" | grep -v '[[:alpha:]]') )
      [ ${#dig_output[@]} -eq 0 ] || resolved_ips+=("${dig_output[@]}")
    done

  if [ ${#resolved_ips[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    local -ar unique_resolved_ips=( $(printf '%s\n' "${resolved_ips[@]}" | sort -u) )
    [ ${#unique_resolved_ips[@]} -eq 0 ] || { echo "${unique_resolved_ips[@]}" ; force_dns "$domain" "${unique_resolved_ips[@]}" ; return 0 ;}
  fi

  return 1
}

get_ips_from_aws_service() {
  local -r input="$1"
  local -r ip_range_url="$2"
  local -r ec2_region="$3"

  # Only accepting DYNAMODB and S3 from ip-range service
  if [[ "$input" =~ ^("DYNAMODB"|"S3")$ ]]; then
    # Echoes IPs of the Service
    curl -s "${ip_range_url}" --connect-timeout 5 | jq -r '.prefixes[] | select(.region=="'$ec2_region'") | select(.service=="'$input'") | .ip_prefix'
  fi
}

get_protected_ips_from_protected_endpoints() {
  local get_ips="$1"
  local -ar endpoints=("${@:2}")

  for e in "${endpoints[@]}"; do
    local ips_output
    ips_output=$(eval "get_ips \"$e\"")
    if [[ -n "$ips_output" ]]; then
      local -a ips=()
      read -ra ips <<< "$ips_output"
      PROTECTED_IPS+=("${ips[@]}")
    fi
  done

  return 0
}

get_protected_ips_from_ssm_connections() {
  local -r regex="$1"

  if pgrep ssm > /dev/null; then
    local -r ssm_connections=( $(lsof -a -nPi4 -c /ssm/ -Fn | awk '$1 ~ /^n/' | awk -F'->' '{print $2}' | awk -F':' '{print $1}' | awk "/$regex/" | awk NF) )
    [ ${#ssm_connections[@]} -eq 0 ] || PROTECTED_IPS+=("${ssm_connections[@]}")
  fi

  return 0
}

get_sorted_unique_protected_ips() {
  if [ ${#PROTECTED_IPS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    PROTECTED_IPS=($(for ip in "${PROTECTED_IPS[@]}"; do echo "${ip}"; done | sort -u))
  fi

  return 0
}

get_ips()
{
  local -r input="$1"

  get_ips_from_input "$input" "$IP_CIDR_REGEX" ||
  get_ips_from_input "$input" "$IP_REGEX" ||
  get_ips_from_dns "$input" ||
  get_ips_from_aws_service "$input" "$IP_RANGES_URL" "$EC2_REGION"
}

validate_interface_exists "$INTERFACE"
validate_network_ingress_fault_not_running "$TRAFFIC_TYPE"
validate_parameter_within_range "DurationSeconds" $DURATION 1 43200
validate_parameter_is_positive "DelayMilliseconds" $DELAYMILLISECONDS
validate_parameter_is_positive "JitterMilliseconds" $JITTERMILLISECONDS
validate_running_in_ssm_document

FAULT_NAME="Run-Network-Latency-Sources"

IP_RANGES_URL="https://ip-ranges.amazonaws.com/ip-ranges.json"

DELETE_MSG="#delete-after-fault-injection"

# Get the REGION of the instance
EC2_REGION=$AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME

IP_CIDR_REGEX="^(([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])\.){3}([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])(\/(3[0-2]|[1-2][0-9]|[0-9]))$"

IP_REGEX="^(([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])\.){3}([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])$"

IMDS_IP=169.254.169.254

# Endpoints we want to preserve (SSM API)
SSMMESSAGES_ENDPOINT=ssmmessages.$AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME.amazonaws.com
SSM_ENDPOINT=ssm.$AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME.amazonaws.com
EC2MESSAGES_ENDPOINT=ec2messages.$AWS_SSM_REGION_NAME.amazonaws.com

PROTECTED_ENDPOINTS=(
  "${SSMMESSAGES_ENDPOINT}"
  "${SSM_ENDPOINT}"
  "${EC2MESSAGES_ENDPOINT}"
)

PROTECTED_IPS=()
add_imds_ip_to_protected_endpoints "$AWS_SSM_INSTANCE_ID"
get_protected_ips_from_protected_endpoints get_ips "${PROTECTED_ENDPOINTS[@]}"
get_protected_ips_from_ssm_connections "$IP_REGEX"
get_sorted_unique_protected_ips

TARGET_IPS=()
get_target_ips_from_sources get_ips "${SOURCES[@]}"

validate_protected_ips_not_in_target_ips "${TARGET_IPS[*]}" "${PROTECTED_IPS[*]}"

# Function to enable fault for egress
enable_fault_egress() {
  # Exit if FIS network fault is already running
  test_file_exit() {
    if [ "$(ls $1 2>/dev/null | wc -l)" -ge "2" ]; then { echo "Fault might be already running (Found flag file matching "$1"). Exiting..." 1>&2 ; exit 1; } ; fi;
  }
  test_file_exit "/var/lib/amazon/ssm/Run-Network-*.flag"

  echo "Injecting fault..."
  # Send all traffic by default to the band 1:3
  tc qdisc add dev $INTERFACE root handle 1: prio priomap 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2
  exit_code=$?
  if [[ $exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
    echo "Traffic Rule could not be created, perhaps you lack the permission required.";
    echo "tc exited with exit code $exit_code. Exiting.";
    exit "$exit_code"; 
  fi

  # Redirect the matching ip addresses to the band 1:3 where is no network impairments
  for k in ${PROTECTED_IPS[*]}; do
    tc filter add dev $INTERFACE protocol ip parent 1:0 prio 1 u32 match ip dst $k flowid 1:3
  done

  # Creates the qdisc in the band 1:1, but since all traffic goes to band 3, it does not affect it
  tc qdisc add dev $INTERFACE parent 1:1 handle 10: netem delay "${DELAYMILLISECONDS}"ms "${JITTERMILLISECONDS}"ms
  for k in ${TARGET_IPS[*]}; do
    # Redirect the matching ip addresses to the band 1:1
    tc filter add dev $INTERFACE protocol ip parent 1:0 prio 2 u32 match ip dst $k flowid 1:1
  done
}

# Function to disable fault for egress
disable_fault_egress() {
  echo "Rolling back..."
  tc qdisc del dev $INTERFACE parent 1:1 handle 10:
  tc qdisc del dev $INTERFACE root handle 1: prio
  temp_file=$(mktemp)
  sed "/$DELETE_MSG/d" /etc/hosts > $temp_file
  cat $temp_file > /etc/hosts
  rm -f $temp_file
}

# Function to enable fault for ingress
enable_fault_ingress() {
  # Exit if FIS network fault is already running
  test_file_exit() {
    if [ "$(ls $1 2>/dev/null | wc -l)" -ge "2" ]; then { echo "Fault might be already running (Found flag file matching "$1"). Exiting..." 1>&2 ; exit 1; } ; fi;
  }
  test_file_exit "/var/lib/amazon/ssm/Run-Network-*.flag"

  echo "Injecting fault..."
  # tc can only add latency on egress traffic so we use an intermediate device ifb
  # Loading the ifb module (Intermediate Functional Block device)
  modprobe ifb numifbs=2
  exit_code=$?
  if [[ $exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
    echo "Traffic Rule could not be created, perhaps you lack the permission required.";
    echo "modprobe exited with exit code $exit_code. Exiting.";
    exit "$exit_code"; 
  fi

  # Limiting the use of set to the following line to ensure it fails the execution in case of failure
  set -o xtrace
  set -o errexit

  # Bring up the interface
  ip link set dev ifb0 up

  set +o xtrace
  set +o errexit

  # Add an ingress queue to the interface
  tc qdisc add dev $INTERFACE ingress
  for k in ${PROTECTED_IPS[*]}; do
    tc filter add dev $INTERFACE parent ffff: protocol ip prio 1 u32 match ip src $k flowid 1:1
  done
  for k in ${TARGET_IPS[*]}; do
    # Redirect matching traffic to ifb
    tc filter add dev $INTERFACE parent ffff: protocol ip prio 2 u32 match ip src $k flowid 1:1 action mirred egress redirect dev ifb0
  done
  # Apply latency to the ifb interface, leaving the rest untouched
  tc qdisc add dev ifb0 root netem delay "${DELAYMILLISECONDS}"ms "${JITTERMILLISECONDS}"ms
}

# Function to disable fault for ingress
disable_fault_ingress() {
  echo "Rolling back..."
  tc qdisc del dev $INTERFACE ingress
  tc qdisc del dev ifb0 root
  rmmod ifb
  temp_file=$(mktemp)
  sed "/$DELETE_MSG/d" /etc/hosts > $temp_file
  cat $temp_file > /etc/hosts
  rm -f $temp_file
}

#################################
# General fault-execution logic #
#################################

# Function to generate the flag path
get_flag_path() {
  local fault_name="$1"
  local random_string="$2"
  echo "/var/lib/amazon/ssm/$fault_name-$random_string.flag"
}

# Function to generate the rollback path
get_rollback_path() {
  local fault_name="$1"
  local random_string="$2"
  echo "/var/lib/amazon/ssm/$fault_name-$random_string-Rollback.sh"
}

get_user_vars() {
    # Define system variable patterns to exclude
    local patterns=(
        '^BASH_'
        '^COMP_'
        '^EUID$'
        '^PPID$'
        '^SHELLOPTS$'
        '^UID$'
        '^PWD$'
        '^OLDPWD$'
        '^SHLVL$'
        '^_$'
    )
    
    # Join patterns with |
    local exclude_pattern=$(IFS='|'; echo "${patterns[*]}")
    
    # Get variables using set
    set | grep "^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9_]*=" | 
    grep -Ev "$exclude_pattern" | 
    grep -Ev "^(patterns|exclude_pattern)="
}

# Function to create rollback script
create_rollback_script() {
  local FLAG_PATH="$1"
  local ROLLBACK_PATH="$2"
  local MAX_FLAG_AGE_SECONDS="$3"
  local ATTEMPT_ROLLBACK_AT_SECONDS="$4"
  local DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND="$5"

  # Creating a file with rollback check command to be executed by atd
  cat << EOF > "$ROLLBACK_PATH"
#!/bin/bash
# Environment variables needed to run the rollback command
$(get_user_vars)

# Dont sleep if run in terminal
if ! [ -t 0 ] ; then
  sleep $ATTEMPT_ROLLBACK_AT_SECONDS
fi

# Include the function definition
$(declare -f "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND")

if ! [ -f "$FLAG_PATH" ] || [ "\$(( \$(date +%s) - \$(stat -c "%Y" "$FLAG_PATH") ))" -gt $MAX_FLAG_AGE_SECONDS ] || [ -t 0 ]; then
  $DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND
  rm -f "$FLAG_PATH"
  # Dont delete rollback script if run in terminal
  if ! [ -t 0 ] ; then
    rm -f "$ROLLBACK_PATH"
  fi
fi
EOF

  echo "Temporary rollback file created: $ROLLBACK_PATH"
}

# Function to schedule rollback attempt
schedule_rollback_attempt() {
  local ROLLBACK_PATH="$1"
  echo "bash $ROLLBACK_PATH" | at now 2>&1 | grep -v "warning: commands will be executed using /bin/sh"
}

# Function to perform rollback
rollback() {
  local DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND="$1"
  local FLAG_PATH="$2"
  local ROLLBACK_PATH="$3"

  eval "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND" ; local STATUS=$?
  rm -f "$FLAG_PATH"
  rm -f "$ROLLBACK_PATH"
  echo "Rollback done."
  exit $STATUS
}

# Function to run fault injection loop
run_fault_injection_loop() {
  local STOP_TIME="$1"
  local FLAG_PATH="$2"
  local ROLLBACK_PATH="$3"
  local INJECTION_LOOP_SLEEP_SECONDS="$4"
  local DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND="$5"

  # For the duration of the injection, the flag file is updated, and a rollback check is enqueued
  while [[ $(date +%s) -lt $STOP_TIME ]] ; do
    # If the background rollback process fires, it will delete the script
    # from disk containing the rollback logic. That should not happen while
    # this script is running, but if it does, we immediately fail the script
    # to prevent the script from continuing to run as if the fault were active.
    if ! [ -f "$ROLLBACK_PATH" ]; then
      echo "Fault rollback script was deleted from disk prematurely, exiting..." 1>&2
      # though the rollback likely already happened, we attempt rollback again since
      # the rollback script might have been deleted by some unanticipated mechanism
      eval "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND"
      exit 1
    fi
    
    touch "$FLAG_PATH"
    schedule_rollback_attempt "$ROLLBACK_PATH"
    sleep "$INJECTION_LOOP_SLEEP_SECONDS"
  done
}

# Main execution starts here
run_post_fault_injection() {
  local FAULT_NAME="$1"
  local DURATION="$2"
  local ENABLE_FAULT_COMMAND="$3"
  local DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND="$4"

  # Constants
  local -r MAX_FLAG_AGE_SECONDS=10
  local -r INJECTION_LOOP_SLEEP_SECONDS=5
  local -r ATTEMPT_ROLLBACK_AT_SECONDS=20
  local -r STOP_TIME=$(( $(date +%s) + DURATION ))
  local -r RANDOM_STRING=$(LC_ALL=C cat /dev/urandom | LC_ALL=C tr -dc 'a-zA-Z0-9' | head -c 32)
  
  # Define paths
  local -r FLAG_PATH=$(get_flag_path "$FAULT_NAME" "$RANDOM_STRING")
  local -r ROLLBACK_PATH=$(get_rollback_path "$FAULT_NAME" "$RANDOM_STRING")

  # Create rollback script
  create_rollback_script "$FLAG_PATH" "$ROLLBACK_PATH" "$MAX_FLAG_AGE_SECONDS" "$ATTEMPT_ROLLBACK_AT_SECONDS" "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND"

  # Binding the rollback function to these exit signals
  trap 'rollback "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND" "$FLAG_PATH" "$ROLLBACK_PATH"' INT TERM

  echo "Making sure atd daemon is running"
  # atd must be running in order to use "at" later
  atd || { echo "Failed to run atd daemon, exiting..." 1>&2 ; exit 1; }

  echo "Scheduling rollback"
  schedule_rollback_attempt "$ROLLBACK_PATH"

  # Injecting fault
  echo "Enabling fault injection"
  touch "$FLAG_PATH"
  eval "$ENABLE_FAULT_COMMAND"

  # Run fault injection loop
  run_fault_injection_loop "$STOP_TIME" "$FLAG_PATH" "$ROLLBACK_PATH" "$INJECTION_LOOP_SLEEP_SECONDS" "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND"

  # After the desired duration, the fault injection is removed
  rollback "$DISABLE_FAULT_COMMAND" "$FLAG_PATH" "$ROLLBACK_PATH"
}
if [ "$TRAFFIC_TYPE" = "egress" ]; then
  run_post_fault_injection "$FAULT_NAME" "$DURATION" enable_fault_egress disable_fault_egress
else
  run_post_fault_injection "$FAULT_NAME" "$DURATION" enable_fault_ingress disable_fault_ingress
fi
